definition:
If $A = (a_{ij})$ and $B = (b_{ij})$ are real $m\!\times\!n$ matrices,
their [*Frobenius product*]{} is defined as
$$\langle A,\,B \rangle_F \;:=\; \sum_{i,\,j}a_{ij}b_{ij}.$$ It is
easily seen that $\langle A,\,B \rangle_F$ is equal to the trace of the
matrix $A^\intercal B$ and $AB^\intercal $, and that the Frobenius
product is an inner product of the vector space formed by the
$m\!\times\!n$ matrices; it the [*Frobenius norm*]{} of this vector
space.
